text: Thomas Clarkson (28 March 1760 – 26 September 1846) was an English abolitionist. He helped start the Society for Effecting the Abolition of the Slave Trade.Clarkson, Thomas 1808. The history of the rise, progress and accomplishment of the abolition of the slave–trade by the British Parliament. Philadelphia: James P. Parke. == References == Category:1760 births Category:1846 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Cambridge Category:British abolitionists Category:English activists Category:English Anglicans Category:People from Cambridgeshire
title: Thomas Clarkson
